ButtonGroup.name: ButtonGroup

alwaysSelected.description: Forces this group to always have at least one toggle button selected

defaultChildType.description:
Defines the default type of child to be contained in this group.  
Used by WidgetParent to create the default children

label.description: Holds the label for this group of buttons

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration attributes

constructors.description:
The ButtonGroup class provides a container for sets of Buttons.
All buttons added will be extended with Y.WidgetChild.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

alwaysSelectedChange.name: alwaysSelectedChange
alwaysSelectedChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'alwaysSelected' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

defaultChildTypeChange.name: defaultChildTypeChange
defaultChildTypeChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'defaultChildType' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

labelChange.name: labelChange
labelChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'label' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

params.name: value
params.description: text to be shown

_uiSetLabel.description: Sets the label of the container from the value of the label configuration attribute. Creates the <legend> element to hold it if it does not exists.

bindUI.description: Sets listeners for the press event of child buttons, see _onButtonPress.

_onButtonPress.description: Processes the press event of child Buttons to enforce the _alwaysSelected attribute, and to propagate the press event

initializer.description: Sets the listener for the addChild event to extend children with Y.WidgetChild. Publishes the press event

BOUNDING_TEMPLATE.description: Overrides the standard bounding box template to produce a <fieldset>

Y.ButtonGroup._CLASS_NAMES.description: Creates the label className key to be used in the template

Y.ButtonGroup._ATTRS_2_UI.description: Hooks up _uiSetLabel to respond to changes in the label attribute.

Y.ButtonGroup._TEMPLATE.description: Template for the <legend> element to hold the label.  Used by MakeNode.

ButtonGroup.description:
The ButtonGroup class provides a container for sets of Buttons.
All buttons added will be extended with Y.WidgetChild.

AccordionPanel.name: AccordionPanel

content.description: Content to be shown in the body of this accordion panel

resizeable.description:
Allows panels to be resized.
Requires the optional resize-plugin module to be loaded.

closeable.description:
Allows panels to be closed via an icon in the header.
It shows or hides the close icon.  
Panels can be closedvia programming at any time, regardless of this attribute.

label.description: Text to be shown in the header of this accordion panel

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attributes

constructors.description: The AccordionPanel class represents one of the panels within an accordion

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

contentChange.name: contentChange
contentChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'content' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

panelClose.description:
Fired by the panel to signal the accordion to remove this panel.
Closure of the panel can be prevented by listening and halting this event.

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

params.name: value
params.description: new value for the closeeable attribute

_uiSetCloseable.description: Sets the close icon visible or not depending on the attribute closeable

params.name: value
params.description: text to be shown

_uiSetLabel.description: Sets the label on the header of this panel

_afterExpanded.description: Listener for the after Expanded change event, toggles the panel

params.name: value
params.description: content to be shown

_uiSetContent.description: Sets the content on this panel

toggle.description: Toggles this panel from expanded to collapsed

close.description: Convenience method to close this panel. Called when the close icon, if present, is clicked. It fires the panelClose event to signal the container for it to remove the panel from the accordion.

params.name: ev
params.description:
uses target to make sure it is the 
header of this accordion and not that of a nested one

_afterHEADERClick.description: Responds to clicks in the header of this panel to toggle it

_syncUIStdMod.description:
This is an override of WidgetStdMod method to prevent it from re-rendering the 
three sections again and again and wiping out the resize handles

renderUI.description:
Adds the resizer to the body of the three section StdMod
and creates a container for the actual content within

params.name: value
params.description: new value for the resizeable attribute

_uiSetResizeable.description: Plugs/unplugs the resize-plugin (if available) in response to the resizeable attribute

CONTENT_TEMPLATE.description:
With the accordion panel container filled with with WidgetStdMod divs
it seems like too much to have a separate contentBox

_CLASS_NAMES.description: Defines the class names used by MakeNode, later stored in this._classNames.

_HEADER_TEMPLATE.description: Defines the template used by MakeNode to build the container for the header

_EVENTS.description:
Defines the UI events to be attached through MakeNode,
specifically, click on the headers

_TEMPLATE.description: Defines the template used by MakeNode to build the container for the body

_ATTRS_2_UI.description: Defines the attributes that MakeNode should link to _uiSetXxxx methods to reflect them in the UI.

AccordionPanel.description: The AccordionPanel class represents one of the panels within an accordion

Accordion.name: Accordion

multiExpand.description: Whether several panels may be expanded at once.

May be overriden in each panel separately.
Requires the optional resize-plugin module to be loaded.

May be overriden in each panel separately.

_afterThisAccordionPanel:expandedChange.description:
Event listener for child expansion/collapse, ensures that only one is expanded
at a time if multiExpand is not set.

params.name: value
params.description: new value of the closeable attribute

_uiSetCloseable.description: Sets the closeable attribute of all panels to the value set for the whole accordion

params.name: ev
params.description: uses ev.target to locate the panel requesting the close

_afterThisAccordionPanel:panelClose.description: Listens to the panelClose and destroys the panel and removes it from the collection of panels.

params.name: value
params.description: new value of the resizeable attribute

_uiSetResizeable.description: Sets the resizeable attribute of all panels to the value set for the whole accordion

_EVENTS.description:
Defines events that are to be associated to listeners by MakeNode.
Here it links a couple of events from the items,
expandedChange to ensure only one panel is open at a time and
panelClose to destroy and remove a panel

_ATTRS_2_UI.description: Defines the attributes that MakeNode should link to _uiSetXxxx methods to reflect them in the UI.

Accordion.description: A collection of vertically aligned collapsible panels

MakeNode.name: MakeNode

constructors.description: Creates CSS classNames from suffixes listed in _CLASS_NAMES, stores them in this._classNames. Concatenates _ATTRS_2_UI into _UI_ATTRS. Sets listeners to render and destroy events to attach/detach UI events. If there is no renderUI defined in this class or any of its ancestors (not counting Widget which has a dummy one) it will add a default one appending the result of processing _TEMPLATE and then call _locateNodes.

_autoRenderUI.description: Method to be used if no explicit renderUI method is defined.

return.description: Instance of Y.Node produced from the template

_makeNode.description: Processes the template given and returns a Y.Node instance.

params.name: template
params.description: (optional) Template to process. If missing, it will use the first static _TEMPLATE property found in the inheritance chain.

params.name: extras
params.description: (optional) Hash of extra values to replace into the template, beyond MakeNode's processing codes.

_substitute.description: Processes the given template and returns a string

params.name: template
params.description: Template to process.

params.name: extras
params.description: (optional) Hash of extra values to replace into the template, beyond MakeNode's processing codes.

_concatUIAttrs.description: Concatenates the entries of the _ATTRS_2_UI static property of each class in the inheritance chain into this instance _UI_ATTRS property for the benefit or Widget. See Widget._UI_ATTRS

_attachEvents.description: Attaches the events listed in the _EVENTS static property of each class in the inheritance chain.

return.description: Array of arguments found, each converted to its proper data type

_parseMakeNodeArgs.description: Parses the arguments received by the processor of the {m} placeholder. It recognizes numbers, true, false, null and double quoted strings, each separated by whitespace. It skips over anything else.

params.name: arg
params.description: String to be parsed for arguments

_detachEvents.description: Detaches all the events created by _attachEvents

_publishEvents.description:
Publishes the events listed in the _PUBLISH static property of each of the classes in the inheritance chain.
If an event has been publishes, the properties set in the descendants will override those in the original publisher.

params.name: arg1,....
params.description: (optional) If given, list of className keys of the nodes to be located. If missing, all the classNames stored in this._classNames will be located.

_locateNodes.description: Locates the nodes with the CSS classNames listed in the this._classNames property, or those specifically requested in its arguments and stores references to them in properties named after each className key, prefixed with an underscore and followed by "Node". If the className key contains a hyphen followed by a lowercase letter, the hyphen will be dropped and the letter capitalized. Any other characters invalid for identifiers will be turned into underscores, thus for the no-label-1 className key a _noLabel_1Node property will be created.

_makeClassNames.description: Looks for static properties called _CLASS_NAMES in each of the classes of the inheritance chain and generates CSS classNames based on the _cssPrefix of each class and each of the suffixes listed in each them. The classNames generated will be stored in this._classNames indexed by the suffix. It will also store the classNames of the boundingBox ( boundingBox )and the contentBox ( content ). If the WidgetStdMod is used, it will also add the classNames for the three sections ( HEADER, BODY, FOOTER )

params.name: x
params.description: name of the static property to be enumerated

params.name: fn
params.description:
function to be called for each value.  
The function will receive a reference to the class where it occurs, the value of the property 
and the key or index.

_forAllXinClasses.description:
Enumerates all the values and keys of a given static properties for all classes in the hierarchy, 
starting with the oldest ancestor (Base).

_CLASS_NAMES.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Holds an array of strings, each the suffix used to define a CSS className using the _cssPrefix of each class. The names listed here are used as the keys into this._classNames, as the argument to the {c} template placeholder and as keys for the entries in the _EVENTS property. They are also used by _locateNodes to create the private properties that hold references to the nodes created.

_PUBLISH.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Contains a hash of events to be published. Each element has the name of the event as its key and the configuration object as its value. If the event has already been published, the configuration of the event will be modified by the configuration set in the new definition. When setting functions use the name of the function, not a function reference.

_eventHandles.description:
An array of event handles returned when attaching listeners to events,
meant to detach them all when destroying the instance.

_classNames.description:
Contains a hash of CSS classNames generated from the entries in _CLASS_NAMES indexed by those same values. It will also have the following entries added automatically:
  • boundingBox The className for the boundingBox
  • content The className for the contentBox
  • HEADER The className for the header section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded
  • BODY The className for the body section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded
  • FOOTER The className for the footer section of a StdMod if Y.WidgetStdMod has been loaded

_EVENTS.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Contains a hash of elements to attach event listeners to. Each element is identified by the suffix of its generated className, as declared in the _CLASS_NAMES property.
There are seveal virtual element identifiers,
  • "boundingBox" identifies the boundingBox of the Widget
  • "content" its contextBox
  • "document" identifies the document where the component is in
  • "THIS" identifies this instance
  • "Y" identifies the YUI instance of the sandbox
If the Y.WidgetStdMod extension is used the "HEADER", "BODY" and "FOOTER" identifiers will also be available.
Each entry contains a type of event to be listened to or an array of events. Each event can be described by its type (i.e.: "key", "mousedown", etc). MakeNode will associate this event with a method named "_after" followed by the element identifier with the first character capitalized and the type of event with the first character capitalized (i.e.: _afterBoundingBoxClick, _afterInputBlur, _afterThisValueChange, etc.) Alternatively, the event listener can be described by an object literal containing properties
  • type (mandatory) the type of event being listened to
  • fn the name of the method to handle the event. Since _EVENTS is static, it has no access to this so the name of the method must be specified
  • args extra arguments to be passed to the listener, useful, for example as a key descriptor for key events. 
    _EVENTS: {
    boundingBox: [
         {
              type: 'key',
              fn:'_onDirectionKey',   // calls this._onDirectionKey
              args:((!Y.UA.opera) ? "down:" : "press:") + "38, 40, 33, 34"
         },
         'mousedown'          // calls this._afterBoundingBoxMousedown
    ],
    document: 'mouseup',     // calls this._afterDocumentMouseup
    input: 'change'          // calls this._afterInputChange
},

_templateHandlers.description:
Hash listing the template processing codes and the functions to handle each.
The processing functions will receive a string with the arguments that follow the processing code,
and the extra, second argument passed on to _makeNode (or _substitute)
and should return the replacement value for the placeholder.

_TEMPLATE.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Holds the default template to be used by _makeNode when none is explicitly provided.
The string should contain HTML code with placeholders made of a set of curly braces enclosing an initial processing code and arguments. Placeholders can be nested, any of the arguments in a placeholder can be another placeholder.
The template may also contain regular placeholders as used by Y.substitute, whose values will be extracted from the second argument to _makeNode. The processing codes are:
  • {@ attributeName} configuration attribute values
  • {p propertyName} instance property values
  • {m methodName arg1 arg2 ....} return value from instance method. The m code should be followed by the method name and any number of arguments. The placeholder is replaced by the return value or the named method.
  • {c classNameKey} CSS className generated from the _CLASS_NAMES static property
  • {s key} string from the strings attribute, using key as the sub-attribute.
  • {? arg1 arg2 arg3} If arg1 evaluates to true it returns arg2 otherwise arg3. Argument arg1 is usually a nested placeholder.
  • {1 arg1 arg2 arg3} If arg1 is 1 it returns arg2 otherwise arg3. Used to produce singular/plural text. Argument arg1 is usually a nested placeholder.
  • {n p1 arg1 .... pn argn} It will read the value resulting from the processing code p1 with argument arg1 and use that as the object to process the following processing code. It takes any number of processing codes and arguments. It only works with processing codes that take simple identifiers as arguments, ie.: not {m}.
  • {} any other value will be handled just like Y.substitute does.
For placeholders containing several arguments they must be separated by white spaces. Strings must be enclosed in double quotes, no single quotes allowed. The backslash is the escape character within strings. Numbers, null, true and false will be recognized and converted to their native values. Any argument can be a further placeholder, enclosed in its own set of curly braces.

_ATTRS_2_UI.description:
** This is a documentation entry only. This property is not defined in this file, it can be defined by the developer. **

Lists the attributes whose value should be reflected in the UI. It contains an object with two properties, BIND and SYNC, each containing the name of an attribute or an array of names of attributes. Those listed in BIND will have listeners attached to their change event so every such change is refreshed in the UI. Those listed in SYNC will be refreshed when the UI is rendered. For each entry in either list there should be a method named using the _uiSet prefix, followed by the name of the attribute, with its first character in uppercase. This function will receive the value to be set and the source of the change.

MakeNode.description: An extension for Widget to create markup from templates, create CSS classNames, locating elements, assist in attaching events to UI elements and to reflect attribute changes into the UI. All of its members are either protected or private. Developers using MakeNode should use only those marked protected. Enable the Show Protected checkbox to see them.

Spinner.name: Spinner

minorStep.description: Amount to increment/decrement the spinner when the buttons or arrow up/down keys are pressed.

min.description: The minimum value for the spinner.

parser.description: Function to format the value entered by the user

value.description: The current value of the spinner.

wraparound.description: Whether the values should wrap around to the other end when one end of the range is reached

formatter.description: Function to format the value to be shown to the user

majorStep.description: Amount to increment/decrement the spinner when the page up/down keys are pressed.

strings.description: The strings for the spinner UI (used in the tooltip texts)

constructors.description: Shows an input box with a set of up/down buttons to change its value.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

params.name: prevVal
params.description: value that triggered the wrapping

params.name: newVal
params.description: new value after wrapping

wrapped.description: Fires when one end of the range is reached and the value is folded to the other end.

params.name: event
params.description: An Event Facade object with      the following attribute specific properties added:	<dl>		<dt>prevVal</dt>		<dd>The value of the attribute, prior to it being set</dd>		<dt>newVal</dt>		<dd>The value the attribute is to be set to</dd>		<dt>attrName</dt>		<dd>The name of the attribute being set</dd>		<dt>subAttrName</dt>		<dd>If setting a property within the attribute's value,           the name of the sub-attribute property being set</dd>	</dl>

parserChange.name: parserChange
parserChange.description: Fires when the value for the configuration attribute 'parser' is changed. You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

_afterInputChange.description:
Simple change handler, to make sure user does not input an invalid value.
If an error is detected, focus will return to the input box and the input box highlighted briefly.

params.name: value
params.description: new value to be set

params.name: src
params.description: source of the new value.  If the source is 'ui' the change will be ignored.

_uiSetValue.description: Updates the value of the input box to reflect the value passed in through the value configuration attribute

params.name: dir
params.description: Direction, up or down, to change at each tick

params.name: step
params.description: Amount to change on each tick

_setMouseDownTimers.description:
Initiates mouse down timers, to increment slider, while mouse button
is held down

params.name: value
params.description: value read from the input box

parser.description: Default parser for the user input.  It assumes only integers are expected

params.name: value
params.description: value of wraparound attribute

_uiSetWraparound.description: Attaches the _wrap method as a before-event listener when wraparound is set.

_validateValue.description:
value attribute default validator. Verifies that
the value being set lies between the min/max value

params.name: val
params.description: value to be validated

params.name: ev
params.description: as provided by the key listener

_onDirectionKey.description:
Bounding box Arrow up/down, Page up/down key listener.
Increments/Decrement the spinner value, based on the key pressed.

_clearMouseDownTimers.description: Clears timers used to support the "mouse held down" behavior

params.name: ev
params.description: Event facade produced by the event handler

_afterBoundingBoxMousedown.description:
Bounding box mouse down handler. Will determine if the mouse down
is on one of the spinner buttons, and increment/decrement the value
accordingly.
The method also sets up a timer, to support the user holding the mouse
down on the spinner buttons. The timer is cleared when a mouse up event
is detected.

_afterDocumentMouseup.description:
Document mouse up handler. Clears the timers supporting
the "mouse held down" behavior.

_wrap.description: If attribute wraparound is true this method is set as a before listener for the valueChange event. When one end of the range is reached, it will make it jump to the other end. Changes the newVal property of the event facade, which will be the new value for the attribute. If stepping by more than one, it will advance the value by the remaining amount of the step. Fires the wrapped event when the value is wrapped around.

params.name: value
params.description: value to be shown

formatter.description: Formats the internal value to be shown to the user

renderUI.description:
Renders the HTML elements of this component.  
Uses the TEMPLATE static variable to produce the markup.
Calls _locateNodes to get the references to the elements created.

_CLASS_NAMES.description: List of CSS class name suffixes to be generated and used in the template

HTML_PASER.description: Tells Widget to read the value from the input box if any existing markup is found

_EVENTS.description: Descriptor of DOM events to be listened to and the methods to handle them

_defaultCB.description:
Override the default content box value, since we don't want the srcNode
to be the content box for spinner.

_ATTRS_2_UI.description: Adds the value attribute to the list of attributes whose change needs to be reflected in the UI

Spinner.description: Shows an input box with a set of up/down buttons to change its value.

ButtonSeparator.name: ButtonSeparator

constructors.description: The ButtonSeparator class provides a passive divider to use in between groups of buttons

BOUNDING_TEMPLATE.description: Overrides the standard bounding box template to produce a <span>

ButtonSeparator.description: The ButtonSeparator class provides a passive divider to use in between groups of buttons

Button.name: Button

title.description: Title (tooltip) to set on the button element

default.description: Button is to be the default button

iconPosition.description: Whether the icon should go to the left or to the right of the label

label.description: Label to be shown on the button

callback.description: Function to be called on button click

href.description: href property to set on the button A element

type.description: Defines the button type. One of push, submit or reset.  Any value but submit or reset will assume push.

icon.description: Suffix to be added to the yui3-button-icon- class to set on the button

params.name: cfg
params.description: Configuration Attributes

constructors.description: The Button class provides a fancier type of button.

params.name: value
params.description: url of link to be set.

_uiSetHref.description: Sets the href attribute on the bounding box

params.name: value
params.description: 'left' or 'right'

_uiSetIconPosition.description:
Sets the position of the icon relative to the label.
Spans for icons are always set at either side, 
this method changes a classname in the bounding box
so that one of them is hidden

params.name: value
params.description: label to be set or null for none

_uiSetLabel.description: Sets the icon class for the bounding box

params.name: value
params.description: class suffix (always prefixed with yui3-button-icon-)

_uiSetIcon.description: Sets the icon class for the bounding box

_uiSetTitle.description: Sets the title attribute to the bounding box

_afterBoundingBoxMousedown.description: Adds the pressed class to bounding box

_afterDocumentMouseup.description:
Removes the pressed class.  
MouseUp is listened to at the document body level since the cursor might have moved
away from the pressed button when released.

_uiSetDefault.description: Updates the default class on the bounding box

_callbackFromType.description:
Returns a function based on the type of button. Form buttons such 
as Submit and Reset are attached to their parent form if one is
found.  Otherwise null is returned.

CONTENT_TEMPLATE.description: Overrides the contentBox template to prevent a content box from being drawn

Y.Button.LEFT.description: Constant to set the iconPosition to be to the left of the label

Y.Button._EVENTS.description: DOM events to be listened to, used by the MakeNode extension

BOUNDING_TEMPLATE.description: Overrides the boundingBox template to make it an anchor

_TEMPLATE.description: Template to use by the MakeNode extension

Y.Button.RIGHT.description: Constant to set the iconPosition to be to the right of the label

Y.Button._CLASS_NAMES.description: Class name suffixes for CSS classNames used in the widget

_prevIconClassName.description: Holds the previous value of the className assigned through the icon attribute for easy removal (Eventually it will be dropped, see: http://yuilibrary.com/projects/yui3/ticket/2530486)

HTML_PARSER.description:
HTML Parser assumes srcNode is either a <button> or 
<input type="submit|reset">

Button.description: The Button class provides a fancier type of button.

TimeSpinner.name: TimeSpinner

showAmPm.description: Whether to show the am/pm indicator or show a 24 hours timer.

showSeconds.description: Whether to show the seconds indicator

interval.description: How often to refresh the time displayed

value.default: time at initialization or current time if running

strings.description: Set of localizable strings to be used as tooltips on the spinners.

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attributes

constructors.description: The TimeSpinner shows a set of spinners for hour, minute and optionally seconds and AM/PM.

params.name: ev
params.description: to find out which one wrapped and which way

methods.description:
Listener for the wrapped event of the spinners to propagate 
the changes from seconds to minutes and minutes to hours.

params.name: value
params.description: value to be shown

params.name: src
params.description:
source of the change in value.  
If src===UI, the value comes from the spinners, it needs not be refreshed

_uiSetValue.description: Shows the current value in the set of spinners

params.name: value
params.description: time to be shown

_setTime.description:
Setter for the time value.  
It calculates and saves the offset in between the current time and that set.

_updateTime.description: Callback for the interval timer to update the time shown

params.name: value
params.description: whether to show the seconds spinner or not

_uiSetSeconds.description: Creates or destroys the seconds spinner and attaches/detaches the event listeners.

params.name: value
params.description: milliseconds in between refreshes

_uiSetInterval.description: Sets the interval for refreshing the display

_spFact.description: Helper factory to make a single Spinner

params.name: which
params.description: ClassName key for the spinner and strings subkey for its title

params.name: cfg
params.description: (optional) configuration attribute overrides

params.name: where
params.description: (optional) where to render it

stop.description: Helper method to stop the timer. Same as this.set('running', false);

_getTime.description:
Getter for the time value.  It returns the current time minus the offset 
or the time when it was stopped.

_afterValueChange.description: Listener for a change in any of the spinners, sets the value.

start.description: Helper method to set the timer running. Same as this.set('running', true);

params.name: value
params.description: whether to show the am/pm spinner or not

_uiSetAmpm.description: Creates or destroys the am/pm spinner and attaches/detaches the event listeners.

params.name: value
params.description: run or not

bindUI.description: Sets the listeners for events from the hours and minutes spinners.

renderUI.description:
Renders the hours and minutes spinners. 
The other two, being optional, are rendered when set.

_minSp.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the minutes.

_timer.description: Reference to the timer created by Y.later that updates the time.

_frozenTime.description: Used to store the moment when the timer was stopped

_offset.description:
Difference in milliseconds in between the current time and that displayed.  
Used when the timer is running to display times other than the current time.

_hourSp.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the hours.

_secSp.description: Reference to the Spinner showing the seconds.

TimeSpinner.description: The TimeSpinner shows a set of spinners for hour, minute and optionally seconds and AM/PM.

gallery-makenode.description: An extension for Widget to create markup from templates, create CSS classNames, locating elements, assist in attaching events to UI elements and to reflect attribute changes into the UI. All of its members are either protected or private. Developers using MakeNode should use only those marked protected. Enable the Show Protected checkbox to see them.
gallery-makenode.name: gallery-makenode

gallery-md-accordion.description: The accordion module creates a control with titles and expandable sections for each
gallery-md-accordion.name: gallery-md-accordion

gallery-md-timespinner.description:
Shows and accepts a time via a set of spinners.  
It can run showing the current time.
gallery-md-timespinner.name: gallery-md-timespinner
